claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: Figure showing a comparison of hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content per influenza strain for Flublok versus standard-dose flu vaccines, alongside immunogenicity data (e.g., hemagglutination inhibition titers) demonstrating a stronger immune response with Flublok. Evidence: Flublok contains 45 µg HA per strain versus 15 µg in standard-dose vaccines (3× the antigen) and correspondingly higher immunogenicity measurements. The image shows that Flublok delivers 45 µg of HA per strain—three times the 15 µg in standard-dose vaccines—and presents immunogenicity data linking this higher antigen content to improved immune responses, which supports the claim.
